text: these photographs tell a story you

like to be with that gang of geniuses
everybody had seen so many photographs

I wanted to do something totally

the camera and how he manipulated and

and it proved to be an enormous
interesting and an important side to his

very much a labor of love I stole a lot
of Picasso when I moved to the south of
France to Provence in the 1950s he was
fascinated by photography I think that
he saw the camera Morris as a as a
mechanism that was enormous be useful to
him
for instance as he was working on a
sculpture he would photograph it and
that because you changed the step and
may make the neck shorter or longer and
he wanted to keep a record of that so he
could see exactly always where he was as
photography becomes more widely
recognized as an art and it's a very
important art I think it's very
interesting to see how a great artist
like Picasso
